Ideographic: A tree 朿 with many thorns 朿

• ⿱ Above to below
    • 朿 [ cì ] thorn, sting, prickle; to stab; to assassinate
    • 朿 [ cì ] thorn, sting, prickle; to stab; to assassinate
heisig_chinese_memo: A new generation of jujubes (Chinese dates) has been grown but it has lots of thorns on the plant which makes them hard to pick and expensive.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A jujube is a Chinese date (as in the fruit) that is hard to pick.  It grows on ice patches surrounded with thorns (not really, but paints a funny picture).
humanum_full_description_en:
" Jujube " and " thorn " are both from the two "朿", the two use the position between the radicals as a distinction, the radical is juxtaposed as " spin ", and the upper and lower one is " zao ". " Jujube " refers to the jujube tree, a thorny shrub, which is taller and larger than " thorn " (Qiu Xigui). The characters of the Warring States Period mostly " come " from the second.

The inscription " Jujube " is pronounced as " made " and refers to manufacture. See Yicheng halberd: "Yicheng Zhizao (made) halberd." Another " zao " is used as the place name, and wild jujube Ge: "Wild jujube." Warring States sword coin is also used As the place name, Korean won: "You (Sour Province) Jujube."

The " zao " on the Qin bamboo slips is pronounced " morning ", referring to the morning, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. The 14th Jane of Japanese Book A Type: "Lizao (early) is not good for Mo (twilight)."

Han silk book refers to jujube, "Sleeping Tiger Land Silk Book. "Fifty-two prescriptions" line 244: "The big one is like a jujube, and the small one is like a date pit." The whole sentence means that the big one is like a date, and the small one is like a date and is square. "The Book of Songs. Bin Feng. "July": "Peel the dates in August and get rice in October."
humanum_short_description_en: From the second "朿", it means the jujube tree is prickly, and the original meaning is the jujube tree. "Shuowen": "Jujube, Yang Jujube. Cong Zhongzhen."
humanum_full_description:
「棗」與「棘」皆從二「朿」，兩者利用偏旁之間的位置作區別，偏旁並列的為「棘」，上下重疊的為「棗」。「棗」即酸棗樹，是多刺的灌木，比「棘」更高大(裘錫圭)。戰國文字多從二「來」。

　　金文「棗」讀為「造」，指製造，見宜乘戟︰「宜乘之棗(造)戟。」另「棗」用作地名，酸棗戈：「酸棗。」戰國刀幣亦用作地名，韓幣：「酉(酸之省)棗。」

　　秦簡「棗」讀為「早」，指早上，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡14正：「利棗(早)不利莫(暮)。」

　　漢帛書指棗子，《睡虎地帛書．五十二病方》第244行：「大者如棗，小者如棗核者方。」全句指大的好像棗子，小的好像棗核而呈方形。《詩經．豳風．七月》：「八月剝棗，十月穫稻。」
humanum_short_description: 從二「朿」，會棗樹多刺之意，本義是棗樹。《說文》：「棗，羊棗也。从重朿。」

①落葉灌木或喬木，枝有刺，葉卵形，開小黃花，核果稱“棗子”或“棗兒”，橢圓形，熟時紅色，可食：棗紅。棗泥。囫圇吞棗(喻讀書等不加分析辨別地籠統接受)。

「 棗 」與「 棘 」皆從二「 朿 」，兩者利用偏旁之間的位置作區別，偏旁並列的為「 棘 」，上下重疊的為「 棗 」。「 棗 」即酸棗樹，是多刺的灌木，比「 棘 」更高大(裘錫圭)。戰國文字多從二「 來 」。 金文「 棗 」讀為「 造 」，指製造，見宜乘戟︰「宜乘之棗(造)戟。」另「 棗 」用作地名，酸棗戈：「酸棗。」戰國刀幣亦用作地名，韓幣：「酉(酸之省)棗。」 秦簡「 棗 」讀為「 早 」，指早上，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡14正：「利棗(早)不利莫(暮)。」 漢帛書指棗子，《睡虎地帛書．五十二病方》第244行：「大者如棗，小者如棗核者方。」全句指大的好像棗子，小的好像棗核而呈方形。《詩經．豳風．七月》：「八月剝棗，十月穫稻。」
" Jujube" and " thorn" are both from the two " 朿", the two use the position between the radicals as a distinction, the radical is juxtaposed as " spin", and the upper and lower one is " zao". " Jujube" refers to the jujube tree, a thorny shrub, which is taller and larger than " thorn" (Qiu Xigui). The characters of the Warring States Period mostly " come" from the second. The inscription " Jujube" is pronounced as " made" and refers to manufacture. See Yicheng halberd: "Yicheng Zhizao (made) halberd." Another " zao" is used as the place name, and wild jujube Ge: "Wild jujube." Warring States sword coin is also used As the place name, Korean won: "You (Sour Province) Jujube." The " zao" on the Qin bamboo slips is pronounced " morning", referring to the morning, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. The 14th Jane of Japanese Book A Type: "Lizao (early) is not good for Mo (twilight)." Han silk book refers to jujube, "Sleeping Tiger Land Silk Book. "Fifty-two prescriptions" line 244: "The big one is like a jujube, and the small one is like a date pit." The whole sentence means that the big one is like a date, and the small one is like a date and is square. "The Book of Songs. Bin Feng. "July": "Peel the dates in August and get rice in October."

棗字的基本解释

棗
zǎo
见“枣”。

棗字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zǎo］
［《廣韻》子晧切，上晧，精。］
亦作“栆1”。“枣1”的繁体字。
(1)木名。鼠李科。落叶灌木或乔木。有直立或钩状刺，叶子卵形或长圆形。聚伞花序，小花，呈黄绿色，有花盘，多蜜。结核果，鲜嫩时黄色，成熟后紫红色，卵形、长圆形或球形，味甘甜，可食，亦供药用。木材坚硬，可供雕刻，或作车船、家具等。
(2)枣树的果实。
(3)姓。晋有枣据。见《晋书》本传。

棗字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　棗； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页532第18
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?子皓切，音蚤。【說文】果名。【小爾雅】棘實謂之棗。【埤雅】大者棗，小者棘。于文?朿爲棘，重朿爲棗，蓋棗性重喬，棘則低矣。　又【儀禮·士昏禮】婦摯舅用棗栗。【疏】以早自謹飭爲義。棗，早也。栗，肅也。【聘禮】夫人勞?，使下大夫勞以二竹簠兼執之以進。【註】右手執棗，左手執栗。【疏】棗美，故用右手也。　又酸棗，地名。【前漢·地理志】屬陳留郡。　又姓，出潁川棘子成後，避仇改爲棗。◎按棗、棘字，《說文》別立朿部，今倂入。

棗字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
棗字的起名意思

同“枣”。

Basic explanation of words
date
zǎo
See "Jujube".
date
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zǎo］
["Guangyun" Zi Hao cut, Shang Hao, fine. ]
Also known as "栆1". The traditional characters of "Jujube 1".
(1) Wooden name. Rhamnaceae. Deciduous shrubs or trees. There are upright or hooked spines, and the leaves are oval or oblong. Cymes, small flowers, yellow-green, with discs, and many honey. Tuberculosis fruit, yellow when fresh, purple-red when mature, oval, oblong or spherical, sweet and edible, and also for medicinal use. The wood is hard and can be used for carving, or as vehicles, ships, furniture, etc.
(2) The fruit of the jujube tree.
(3) Last name. Jin has a date according to it. See the biography of "Book of Jin".
date
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　zao; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 532 18
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Jiyun] [Yunhui]? Zi Hao cut, sound flea. 【Said the text】The name of the fruit. 【Xiao Erya】The thorns are actually called jujubes. 【Piya】The big one is jujube, the small one is thorny. Yu Wen? The spine is a thorn, the heavy 朿 is a jujube, the jujube is a heavy arbor, and the spine is low.　[Yi Li·Shi Hun Li] The wife's uncle used jujube chestnut. 【Sparse】It is righteous to take care of yourself early. Jujube, early too. Li, Su Ye. [Borrowing Ceremony] Madam’s hard work, so that the doctor can work hard with both bamboo and bamboo. [Note] The right hand holds the jujube and the left hand holds the chestnut. 【Sparse】Zaomei, so use your right hand.　Sweet dates, place names. [Former Han Geography] belongs to Chenliu County.　The surname is again, after the birth of Yingchuan Shizi, the vengeance was changed to jujube. ◎According to the date and the word thorn, "Suowen" does not have the Lipu department, and now it is stubbornly entertaining.
